result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam P Dies was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber.
Standard release conditions.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with the victim.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Comply with any pending injunction.

Defendant Adam P Dies in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting adjournment to have time to speak with her client. State has no objections. Court grants.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Three Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Forms received 12/14/15

Reviewed by Judge Maxwell 12/15/15
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim listed in the complaint.

Defendant Adam P Dies in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest plea as to count 3 and counts 1, 2 and 4 are dismissed and read-in. Matter adjourned for sentencing. Attorney weathers addressed the no contact provision in the bond. Victim presents statements to the court. State presents arguments.Court grants the request and orders no violent contact with the victim.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam P Dies in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Adam P Dies in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness except as authorized thru any injunction regarding his children.

Defendant Adam P Dies in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
